greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle of numbers that are 0 or 1 mod 3.
comment: The matrix operations (J * R), (R * J) are commutative since J * R = R * J.
Rows and columns of the triangle are all 0 or 1 mod 3 terms: A032766.
formula: All columns (with offset); and all rows (starting from the right) are 0 or 1 mod 3 (A032766). Extract the triangle from the product J * R; J = [1; 2, 1; 1, 2, 1; 2, 1, 2, 1; ...]; R = [1; 1, 1; 1, 1, 1; ...] (infinite lower triangular matrices, with the rest zeros).
maple: it:=array(1..1000): i:=1: for n from 1 to 1000 do if n mod 3 <> 2 then it[i]:=n; i:=i+1 fi: od: for j from 1 to 25 do for k from j to 1 by -1 do printf(`%d,`,it[k]) od: od: # _James A. Sellers_, Apr 09 2005
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Mar 16 2005
ext: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Apr 09 2005
